content.question: Which of the following best explains why larger grapes have a different rate of water absorption per gram of mass than smaller grapes do?

choices.label: The rate is slower because smaller grapes have a larger surface-area-to-volume ratio than the larger grapes do.
The rate is slower because larger grapes have a larger surface-area-to-volume ratio than the smaller grapes do.
The rate is slower because smaller grapes can expand more than larger grapes to hold excess water.
The rate is slower because larger grapes have more volume to hold excess water than smaller grapes do.

content.answer: The rate is slower because smaller grapes have a larger surface-area-to-volume ratio than the larger grapes do.
